critique: This document amends the Manual for Courts-Martial regarding offenses and punishments for violations of Article 113 of the Uniform Code of Military Justice. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt without knowing the specifics of Article 113 and the changes being made. However, given the nature of military justice, a balanced approach is assumed. Immigration is not relevant. The document does not seem to expand executive power, as it is an amendment within an existing legal framework. Federalism is not relevant. The document likely leans towards national security, as it deals with military justice. Economic regulation is not relevant. Social inclusion is not directly addressed, so a neutral stance is assumed.
